title: Zoe is a champion that rewards bad gameplay.
body:
One of the main issues that is inevitably swallowing modern league of legends design is the fact that more modern champions just don't have any punishment to them. No matter how you screw up, or how badly you play them, they always have too many mechanics that hold the hands of the players who're using them until they inevitably score those kills, sometimes the wins, and then the player can feel good about themselves. 

Zoe is a very toxic example of this. Designed around a 1 use combo? Stupidly low cooldowns. Love to spam your abilities off cooldowns? Low mana costs and mana regen from items and runes is through the roof. Lots of skill shots? Along with the low cooldowns, she has blazing fast missile speeds and massive ranges. Missed your primary damage? As long as you hit you hit your CC then it will amplify your passive and will hit like a truck. Just out right dropped the ball? An RNG system that outright destroys and mocks the concepts of summoner spells and investing gold to actually obtain an active. Someone build MR? Free true damage build into her rotation. 

 Did you know that with the +5% max CDR rune zoe can actually CC a champion and then have her E back up in 2.2 seconds? 

There's legitimately nothing to actually exploit or look for in Zoe's kit that would give you a window of opportunity. Technically you could count on the player being bad, but that's any champion period and doesn't really work as a practical means of counterplay. 

She's a no risk all reward champion. She's basically an assassin with the ability to pick someone from extreme ranges then engage for an almost guaranteed 1 shot with little to no risk to herself. 

I can get behind how her kit operates, I think most can. But there needs to be a shit ton more punishment for screwing up than there is now. 


Swap her E and R. Her sleepy bubble gets turned into her ult and given a full ultimate level cooldown. Then make it so she only gets the CD refund if she actually damages the target after they've been put to sleep. 

Remove the guaranteed return on her blink. If she gets hit with hard CC during her blink then she shouldn't beable to return.

Finally, remove the ability for minions to drop her W stacks for actives and summoners. Instead make it so it drops blank bubbles that simply allow her to activate her W for free and make this effect available on every minion wave rather than RNG. That, or at the very least massively reduce the duration that bubbles stay around and then reduce the effectiveness of actives and summoners that are dropped by minions.

replies.body:
Zoe is a "high skill cap" champ because her Q and E are skillshots and she is very reliant upon positioning in order to land those abilities or maximize use of her W and R in the combos.

Except Zoe excellently demonstrates why this narrative is a false one for Riot.  Maybe she is "high skill cap" compared to many other champions who have abilities which are easier to land or who aren't as reliant upon positioning.  Except for a couple things:

1. She is a very forgiving champ due to her low CD's, mana costs, and the power that W gives her in gaining extra item actives or summoner spells (pre-6 teleport dropped by minion = free buy and lane pressure).

2. She has insane pick potential similar to that of Nidalee and Blitzcrank.  You can miss 100 Q's but once you land one that's it.

3. Most importantly - high skill cap is a relative term.  None of the champions are what I would define as "difficult" to play.  Spend a couple of games with them, learn their abilities, their strengths and weaknesses, etc.  Great, now you can play that champion decently or very well.  But since Riot thinks that champ is a high skill cap champion, you now have access to more power than you would with similar other champions.  There's now no reason not to play him/her until that power gets nerfed.

I've played a good bit of Zoe since she came out.  I currently ban her if I'm not first pick.  Is that because I think she's extremely overpowered?  Not really, I've faced Zoe's mid and I know I can handle her.  But she is REALLY ANNOYING to play against and I'm not sure my teammates know how to play around her.  So she gets banned.

I face her many time and currently I discover how usefull are Tahm and Morg vs her. Tahm can save his teamate from a target in sleep mode and Morg can prevent a sleep when she cast a bubble be advise that you need to bubble before the sleep land.

She mostly is annoying to play agaisnt like most of CertainlyT champ.

Yep, she's annoying but not supremely overpowered.

Malzahar, Morgana, Orianna, Corki are currently safe picks versus her that I like.  I mainly play mages, but I've seen Katarina/Leblanc/Zed do well also due to their dashes.  

I don't have much experience vs. her in the support role.
No sustain and one CC that's easily blocked by minions. She's like a weaker Brand with a more annoying VO.

Well, Brand's single-spell damage is WAY lower, and his CC is conditional. So I don't really consider the two to be at all comparable.

Brand is a DoT mage, Zoe is a burst mage.

Brand isn't really a DoT mage, though. He doesn't have the tankiness to stay on the field for a long time, the only damage over time thing about him is his burn, but other than that he's basically an immobile, AOE, burst mage. 

Also, while it technically is, I wouldn't call his CC conditional; the only requirement to landing it is pressing a point and click spell on someone.

> [{quoted}](name=Crede777,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=tAUEn31f,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2017-12-12T20:47:08.682+0000)
>
> Yep, she's annoying but not supremely overpowered.
> 
> Malzahar, Morgana, Orianna, Corki are currently safe picks versus her that I like.  I mainly play mages, but I've seen Katarina/Leblanc/Zed do well also due to their dashes.  
> 
> I don't have much experience vs. her in the support role.

Agreed. She's annoying but definitely not impossible to beat. I've gone against her in mid (I actually played Vlad against her once, that was a pretty fun match) and did a duo where I went mid and duo partner was adc against a support Zoe. Both games that I mentioned she lost. In fact, almost every game I've played where the enemy team has a Zoe they've lost (for various reasons). She's tough to lane against but you can definitely still win against her.
kk so why his xerath having two bar of difficult while she has 3 of them ?
Do you really believe Riot's difficulty meter is any closer to reliable?

Well Xerath is mostly stationary when casting abilities while Zoe has twice as many variables in her kit and has to land stuff at high speeds with small hitboxes.

But the point stands: She's far more forgiving than Xerath has ever been which makes "difficulty" a very subjective term.
As if being stationary is an advantageous characteristic of a champion.
This is about difficulty of playing said champion not whether or not it's abusable. Everyone has weaknesses.

They do, but some of them have their weaknesses layered behind so many walls of mechanics that any single champion has no chance of exploiting that weakness even with full us of their kit, in some cases even when executed perfectly. They're still dependent on the other player to make a mistake and/or waste mechanics. 

When it comes to being difficult to play a champion, then i'd say that lacking mobility is an inherently more difficult design to play, both offensively and defensively. 
You can't rapidly correct your positioning, meaning that you must more accurately, and more quickly, predict the results and movement of the fight. 

Now that window for positioning can move, where some champions with more range will want to position themselves further from  the fight, but more range doesn't make changing your positing easier.

The thing is, if her Q/empowered Q dealt half it's damage nobody would bat an eye.

She actually is overpowered.

Over/under-powered is mostly about numbers.
The fact she can spam her Q and E off cooldown and basically not run out of mana is a matter of numbers.
The fact that one EQ in mid game deals 80%+ of your HP is a matter of numbers.
The fact she's uncatchable because her E gets a stupid CD refund on hitting people? A matter of numbers as well.

Nobody would bat an eye because nobody would play her.  She'd be garbage if she couldn't put out the amount of damage expected from a mid-laner.

Literally everything in this game is a matter of numbers btw.  CC duration, movement speed, dash/blink range, attack speed, champion hitbox, etc.  

Name one thing relevant to the balance of the game that isn't numbers, please.
Kit of a champion?

I'd say that's not so much balance and more champion design.

Even an overloaded kit can be made balanced by putting weak numbers on everything.  A kit itself isn't inherently imbalanced if you allow for the manipulation of all the numbers in it.

Though this could certainly result in boring/unsatisfying champions.  In fact, the most balanced set-up would be to set it so all champions are effectively identical.

Have you ever played Brave Frontier? 
A champion that covers more roles is always more valuable than a champion that has a niche role. Which is to say, a champion whose kit allows them to perform more tasks (say Ekko mid) will generally be perferred over a champion who can do very little tasks (say Kassadin mid). What champions do is more important than how well they do it, as crazy as it sounds. Because if the design/balance team doesn't know what that is, it's hard to balance around it. This is why AP Yi no longer exists, and why Sion was rework so hard.

So if you reduced the numbers of their damage, health, and cc (or lack of) comparable to a minion, they'd still be more valuable?

Basically if a champ can do several roles but does them all poorly, they aren't going to be picked over a powerful pick for a single role.

Anyways what does that have to do with what was being discussed?  Altering numbers can also generally transfer a champion from split roles to one (like reducing AP ratio and upping base damage to move a mage to support).

Not sure how to say this without retreading. Numbers shouldn't dictate role. Role should dictate numbers. Balancing is more than just slapping numbers onto a kit. You have to think about what the kit is aiming to accomplish and how that affects every other champion in the game. Case in point, Vlad. His kit wants to drain health converted from ability power, but spellvamp basically double dipped, which made it polarizing to balance him and every other champ without spellvamp built into the kit. 

Its just like any other math. It's about more than just the numbers. It's the concepts behind them that matter most :v.
Give her e a 16 second cooldown flat

OR... you know... just remove the CD refunded on hitting anything. Really simple change to make it so much better considering it's like a 9 second CD late game with 40% cdr.

You people list straight up gut tactics here. 16 seconds is way too long.
I mean, Ahri E is a 12 second flat CD that does't get a refund at all, I don't think a 16 second flat CD with a partial refund is that bad.

If you remove the return on her blink when hit by CC it'll just feel like garbage. You won't be able to go in safely and hit a Q when you land a, now much higher cooldown with your changes, bubble in any situation that isn't a 1v1. 

I can agree with a higher cooldown on E but it shouldn't be ultimate level, _especially_ if you can't go in safely with R against multiple enemies.

Edit: I'd also like to say that if she loses a lot of her damage/pick potential she'll become useless. She doesn't have as much waveclear and wave management abilities as other mages, so if she loses her niche as a pick mage there will be no reason to pick her since every other mage has more consistent damage, better waveclear, and more AOE. 

The best way to nerf her right now is hitting her E cooldown and maybe decreasing the speed along with the length that the trap stays on the ground for. This'll bring her in line with other immobile mages in terms of vulnerability and make her a bit less frustrating.

It would make more sense visually if you could stop her from returning and put more pressure on the Zoe to position better. It would also punish a greedy Zoe and allow the team to trade 1 for 1 in a situation that normally favors the Zoe.

It's not really supposed to be a mobility spell. If it's made so the cc stops from blinking back, it can be abused to act like a full mobility by using it at the same time as getting rooted. You can already punish a greedy zoe very easily since you know exactly where she will blink back to.

Being able to be punished for using mobility at a bad time?
Not like almost every other champion with mobility makes themselves vulnerable if they use it poorly

But it isn't true mobility, that's the point.  You always get sent back at a specific point without any control over that.

If you made it interruptible, it would be so crap.

> [{quoted}](name=Fairyfleur,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=tAUEn31f,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2017-12-12T21:41:28.087+0000)
>
> If you remove the return on her blink when hit by CC it'll just feel like garbage. You won't be able to go in safely and hit a Q when you land a, now much higher cooldown with your changes, bubble in any situation that isn't a 1v1. 
> 
> I can agree with a higher cooldown on E but it shouldn't be ultimate level, _especially_ if you can't go in safely with R against multiple enemies.
> 
> Edit: I'd also like to say that if she loses a lot of her damage/pick potential she'll become useless. She doesn't have as much waveclear and wave management abilities as other mages, so if she loses her niche as a pick mage there will be no reason to pick her since every other mage has more consistent damage, better waveclear, and more AOE. 
> 
> The best way to nerf her right now is hitting her E cooldown and maybe decreasing the speed along with the length that the trap stays on the ground for. This'll bring her in line with other immobile mages in terms of vulnerability and make her a bit less frustrating.

Great points.  The fact that she can chain CC people at max CD shows her E cooldown has issues. 

If the CD gets increased a bit I think she will be in a really good spot.

> [{quoted}](name=Fairyfleur,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=tAUEn31f,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2017-12-12T21:41:28.087+0000)
>

> 
> I can agree with a higher cooldown on E but it shouldn't be ultimate level, _especially_ if you can't go in safely with R against multiple enemies.
> 
> Edit: I'd also like to say that if she loses a lot of her damage/pick potential she'll become useless. She doesn't have as much waveclear and wave management abilities as other mages, so if she loses her niche as a pick mage there will be no reason to pick her since every other mage has more consistent damage, better waveclear, and more AOE. 
> 
> The best way to nerf her right now is hitting her E cooldown and maybe decreasing the speed along with the length that the trap stays on the ground for. This'll bring her in line with other immobile mages in terms of vulnerability and make her a bit less frustrating.

so you should just be able to kill/nuke someone for free because you landed 1 skill shot

> [{quoted}](name=UnboundHades,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=tAUEn31f,comment-id=00060004,timestamp=2017-12-14T02:22:59.825+0000)
>
> so you should just be able to kill/nuke someone for free because you landed 1 skill shot

1 skill shot witha  tiny hit box that minions can block and so can allies that in order to do amazing damage has to be pretty much broadcast or has to be used in sneaky and inventive ways. YES IT SHOULD. GIT GUD.

I'd rather her W be like Bard's chimes. Make it so she has to collect say, five shards of summoner spells to get a free one (She still gets a full summoner if an enemy uses one). The shards can be different types and if she can get at least three of the same kind then she gets that specific spell, otherwise what summoner she gets will be random.

Make it so the randomness is the punishment while also making it so there's more to getting summoner spells than just hoping a minion drops the one you want.
The randomness is already a punishment in some ways.  Ever tried laning as her against Zed and getting 2+ Cleanses in a row?

Currently the randomness oscillates between really good or really bad depending on the situation and what she happens to get. 

Here's what I recently posted in a thread.

> So I had the idea of, why not make her W like Bard's chimes? Instead of a random minion dropping a random summoner/active occasionally, bubbles would spawn around the area she's near that contain shards of summoner spells or item actives. In order to get a summoner spell or item active she would need to collect, let's say, five bubbles to get one. What summoner she gets is dependent on whether she collects three of the same kind of shard, if she collects five but doesn't have at least three of the same shard then she will instead get a random summoner based on the shards she's collected.
> 
> So if she got 2 ignite, two flash, and 1 gunblade shards then she'd have a 40% chance of getting ignite or flash and a 20% chance of getting a gunblade active. She would of course still get full summoners from bubbles dropped by enemies.
> 
> This reduces the randomness of her W and makes it so the person playing Zoe has some control over what ability she gets, we could also give her a bar over her health bar that shows what shards she currently has so enemies can make decisions based on what they're seeing she could potentially get. There is still a bit of a gamble involved but it's now one that you can weigh in your favor and since it's more reliable Riot could afford to drain some power from her Q and E.

My point is make it so the randomness is the bad thing but the lows are less punishing than they are now while giving her a good thing in a reliable way to decide on what summoner spell she gets.

Yes I saw that, but I don't really like that idea.  For one thing, the shards would have to spawn significantly more often than they do now, turning her into another minigame champion.  For another, that randomness is something nobody could predict when she goes to pick up that last shard.

Imagine she has 2 gunblade shards, an ignite shard, and a hextech GLP shard.  All of these are aggressive tools that can help to finish off a target.  Then she goes to pick up the last shard which happens to be a TP shard.  By shear chance, she gets TP instead of any of those damage actives, and an otherwise won fight is lost (or reverse scenario winning a fight that should have been lost).

Your idea just seems like it would make the RNG in lane even worse.

But why would a Zoe go to pick up the Teleport shard if she wants an offensive one? Instead she could grab another shard currently spawned that IS an offensive one or wait for another to show up. The RNG is hardly worse, you have control over whether you want to take that risk as apposed to now where you have NO control over what you get.

If the player doesn't want to wait for a shard that is exactly what they want then they can take the risk that they'll get something they don't want. The point is there is a choice for the player as to whether they want to take that risk or not.

Right now you can see exactly what you'll get when you pick up the shard.  With yours there's a decent chance of getting something completely different.

Basically she can currently plan out what she'll do before she picks up the shard.  Your way you'd have to wait until after to be sure.

You're not making sense. With my system she can see what each bubble has a shard of. She looks at one and sees, "Hey that's a smite shard" she can then decide whether to pick it up or not, she can then look around to see what other shards there are and decide on whether she wants to collect all of them now for a pot luck or grab three of them and then sit on them until she gets two more that match one of the three she already has so she gets a specific summoned/ active.

Yes she can currently plan based on what a minion drops but what the minion drops is random.

The reduction in randomness of your method does not seem worth what would be lost from the current system.

Aside from the points that I made before, there is also the difference in where the bubbles come from.  Yours sound like they'd spawn randomly around her which leaves little to no counterplay for the enemy.  With them being connected to minions that Zoe herself has to last hit though, the enemy can potentially deny the grab or go for a favorable trade during it.

There's also the matter of trying to get 3 shards of the same type.  Considering how many active items and summoner spells you can get from it, that's not going to happen too often.  In addition, if you toss bubbles around too often, it will result in cluttered screens.

I simply don't see the benefits of your idea outweighing the costs.
That's actually a pretty good idea. Too bad I can't upvote
Lots of exaggeration from OP.
Defensive Zoe main.
"No risk champ" That's definitely an exaggeration. Just play a diver or someone with decent mobility against her, dodge her E then go in and kill her while she can do absolutely nothing against you.

You can't simply dodge her E if you are melee.

Your best bet is to cower behind/around minions and jump on her when she misses/minion tanks it.
Like you do against Xerath, Lux, Morgana, Ahri, Blitzcrank, Thresh and every other Champ with skillshot CC?

> [{quoted}](name=Wimbledofy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=tAUEn31f,comment-id=000500000002,timestamp=2017-12-12T22:51:10.611+0000)
>
> "No risk champ" That's definitely an exaggeration. Just play a diver or someone with decent mobility against her, dodge her E then go in and kill her while she can do absolutely nothing against you.

Lmao, Zoe is definitely no risk. Far too much mobility to effectively do anything to the champ for the majority of champs in this game.

Zoe IS NOT mobile. An ability that moves you then immediately puts you back is not a mobility spell. She has the possibility of being mobile by getting a lot of flashes, but in general she is low mobility.

Upvoting in the hopes that a Rioter has something to say.

I mean, I know it's not as easy for them to actually respond to points as it is to talk about being misquoted, but one can hope.
U guys did the same thing when they released Yasuo so please , stop crying and improve ur dodges and build some mr .{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

You're missing the point.

The point is, I'm not rewarded for dodging 15 Zoe bubbles or Qs. There's no window for me to take advantage of her missing her skillshots.

Meanwhile, she is _massively_ rewarded for landing a single bubble or Q.

Low risk, high reward.

Also, I play tanks. I soak that shit for my squishies when I can. But all she needs is a single hit and even if my backliner survives, he's out of the fight. Not to mention she and her team can and will absolutely tear into my health pool with a single CC into all of her buttons, MR or not.

But hey, by all means, continue to give me worthless advice. It's _charming_. {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
